title: [Large-Scale] Bio-Terrorism Preparedness Language Escape Game Development Workshop: Integrated Simulation for Communication, Reading, and Writing

context.prior_knowledge: Basic public health knowledge and emergency response experience, foundational language education design skills (grammar-vocabulary application, reading comprehension strategies, and writing structuring techniques)
context.additional_context: Strengthens disaster preparedness simulation design competencies for pre- and in-service language teachers. Focuses on text analysis in emergencies, context-specific expression generation, and collaborative problem-solving skills.

learning_goals: Learners achieve an 80%+ goal completion rate within 60 minutes in a bioterrorism scenario-based escape game by employing teamwork and problem-solving strategies, applying situational communication strategies (e.g., emergency reports, role-specific dialogues).

Explain the design principles of escape games combining digital tools and physical puzzles, and create templates applicable to language education contexts (e.g., integrated reading/writing/listening tasks).

Learners meet team collaboration efficiency metrics (e.g., participation â‰¥85%, idea contributions) through formative assessments and propose improvement plans based on linguistic feedback (e.g., peer evaluation rubrics, self-reflection journals).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
